title: Pride of Britain Awards: Holly Willoughby wears plunging bodycon dress
text:
She is popular This Morning presenter known for her enviable style.

And Holly Willoughby looked sensational as she arrived for the Pride of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday.

The blonde beauty, 38, showcased her incredible figure in an eye-catching scarlet bodycon gown with petal detail lavender and red sleeves as she posed up a storm.

Strike a pose: Holly Willoughby looked sensational as she arrived for the Pride of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday

The stunning gown featured a plunging neckline which teased a glimpse of the star's ample cleavage and nipped in at her toned waist.

It flowed into a elegant floor-length skirt, with the beauty oozing confidence as she walked the red carpet.

Her blonde locks were styled in soft waves while metallic shadow, fluttery lashes and a swipe of scarlet lipstick lit up her gorgeous features.

The star accessorised with sparkling diamond earrings, completing her showstopping look.

Wow: The blonde beauty, 38, showcased her incredible figure in an eye-catching scarlet bodycon gown with petal detail lavender and red sleeves as she posed up a storm

Radiant: The stunning gown featured a plunging neckline which teased a glimpse of the star's ample cleavage and nipped in at her toned waist

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
